content: the pattern assumes a change of colour on each round - fasten_off invisibly or with a slip_stitch into the beginning of the round as appropriate you can begin rounds after the first with a standing stitch or chain substitute - i e chain 1 for single_crochet chain 2 for half_double_crochet chain 3 for double_crochet etc substitute chains will always count as a stitch important instructions are in bold type helpful hints and explanations are in red italics repeat everything between square brackets indicated number of times r1 16 half_double_crochet into magic_ring or chain 4 joined with a slip_stitch substituting chain 2 for the first half_double_crochet 16 half_double_crochet r2 half_double_crochet blo in any st 2 half_double_crochet blo in next st half_double_crochet blo in next st 2 half_double_crochet blo in next st x 7 24 half_double_crochet blo r3 may be tricky - please follow steps on page 3 carefully and check against photo spcl beginning in any st in r2 substituting part-finished standing double_crochet or chain 2 for first leg chain 3 spcl beginning in next st in r2 chain 3 x 7 8 spcl 8 x chain-3 do not skip any sts except the ones in r2 behind the centre of each cluster -
